clinical_study.brief_title: Development of Distress Management Algorithms Using Mobile Device Based Health Logs in Breast Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Development of Distress Management Algorithms Using Mobile Device Based Health Logs in Breast Cancer Survivors

brief_summary.textblock: Distress monitoring is an important issue in cancer survivors. However, conventional distress screening is very difficult to perform. This study investigates the efficacy of wearable device as a tool of distress monitoring in breast cancer survivors.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of distress screening of wearable device
primary_outcome.description: The results of distress screening questionnaire and patterns of physical activities are going to be compared. The association between those two data will be analyzed. Using data of physical activities, the prediction model of distress will be tested and validated.

arm_group.description: Physical activities will be monitored by wearable device. Patient-reported outcomes including distress, depression, physical activities and quality of life are going to be collected by questionnaires based on smartphone application and paper. The algorithm of distress screening will be developed with the analysis of patterns of physical activities.

intervention.intervention_name: Wearable device (Fitbit Charge HR® or Fitbit Alta ®)
intervention.description: Physical activities will be monitored by wearable device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stage 0-III breast cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Stage IV breast cancer
- Breast cancer recurrence or metastasis
- Severe medical illness
